net.sourceforge.waters.model.des

Interface EventProxy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<NamedProxy>, ComparableProxy<NamedProxy>, NamedProxy, Proxy
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EventElement

    public interface EventProxy
extends NamedProxy

    An event used by the automata in a DES.

    Each ProductDESProxy object consists of a set of automata and an event alphabet. Each event can be used by one or more automata; synchronisation is modelled by several automata using the same event. The ProductDESProxy data structure is set up in such a way that each event object is used only once. If several automata (or transitions) share an event, they all will use the same object.

    In contrast to the event declarations of a module (class EventDeclProxy), the events in a ProductDESProxy represent single events only. Each event contains the following information.

    Name.
    A string defining the name of the event. This name may be a result from compilation of a module and therefore may contain special charcters, e.g., machine[1].start.
    Kind.
    The type of the event. This can be controllable, uncontrollable, or proposition.
    Observability.
    A boolean flag, indicating whether the event is observable.
    Author:
    Robi Malik

    • Method Detail

      • getKind

        EventKind getKind()
        Gets the kind of this event.
        Returns:
        One of EventKind.CONTROLLABLE, EventKind.UNCONTROLLABLE, or EventKind.PROPOSITION.

      • isObservable

        boolean isObservable()
        Gets the observability status of this event.
        Returns:
        true if the event is observable, false otherwise.

      • getAttributes

        Map<String,String> getAttributes()
        Gets the attribute map for this event. The attribute map can be used by tools supporting external model formats to store information that does not appear in standard DES models.
        Returns:
        An immutable map mapping attribute names to values.
